newsitem.title: HONG KONG: RESEARCH ALERT - Lehman favours Hutchison.
newsitem.headline: RESEARCH ALERT - Lehman favours Hutchison.

text.p: Lehman Brothers said on Thursday it has initiated coverage of Hutchison Whampoa Ltd with an "outperform" rating based on what it called the conglomerate's "superior earnings potential".
In a research report dated October 30, the investment bank said the market had been looking at short-term negative news at the expense of Hutchison's longer-term potential for growth.

"While overseas investors have been quick to invest in HSBC and property stocks as a proxy for optimism beyond 1997, Hutchison appears to be sidelined," Lehman financial analyst Christopher Alexander said in a statement.
Lehman noted that Hutchison is Hong Kong's largest diversified company, accounting for 8.8 percent of the market.

The report cited as strengths the expansion of Hutchison's operations in China to include port developments, retailing and a joint venture with Proctor & Gamble Co as well as its association with British mobile phone operator Orange Plc.
"Combined with its sheer size, broad spread of activities and good liquidity, Hutchison is an ideal warrant on Hong Kong for an institutional investor," Alexander said.

Lehman said it expected 1996 earnings per share of HK$2.02 against an anticipated HK$3.14 due to "the expected absence of property development profits and peaking losses by Orange in the U.K. against good growth in the ports and retailing operations as well as (Canadian oil company) Husky ".
After the flat EPS performance of 1996, Lehman said it saw growth to HK$2.90 in 1997 and HK$3.52 in 1998.
Hutchison shares closed Thursday's session up 25 H.K. cents at HK$56.25.
